intro: Sidalcea delphiniifolia, commonly known as the Delphiniifolia checker-mallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. It is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Sidalcea delphiniifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits to pollinators.
